results.title: Farming: Soviet style
results.creator_credit: Arch Nicholson, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Soviet style”.
Examines the Soviet agricultural system, the collective farms, or Kolkhoz, the State farms, or Sovkhoz and the importance of the agricultural private plot. Credits include: photography by Dean Semler; script by Roger Milliss; edited by Martyn Down; sound by Howard Spry and commentary by Margaret Throsby.

results.title: The View from within (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “The Real thing”.
Looks at the complexity of the brain handling the simplest activity, like going to a party. James Burke’s consciousness steps out of his body for a while to demonstrate how it acts as “mission controller” for his own private universe

results.title: Time out of mind (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Real thing”.
When is reality? In order to answer this question James Burke finds himself in a Salvador Dali-like landscape and examines what motivates man, why light can never stand still, and why one man’s “now” can be another man’s “then”

results.title: This way up
results.creator_credit: Mike Jackson and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
James Burke goes to the top of the Blackpool Tower and turns upside down to discover how the ears talk to the eyes and how we know which way is down. Looks at the sense of balance and other ways we perceive which way is up. The use of vision and retinal cells to detect movement and distance is studied in detail.
Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: The Private eye (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Mick Jackson and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “The Real thing”.
Shot in the style of a 1940’s film, James Burke employs a detective to illustrate how the senses pick up clues from the outside world, how the brain solves the mystery and decides what is out there. Illustrates how easy it is to fool the best detective, and asks “what is reality”? Part one of a series of six programs written and presented by James Burke. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Life sentence (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Mick Jackson and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “The Real thing”.
Part 6 of a series examining the latest research into the workings of the human brain. This film considers language and human use of it, noting how the meaning of a word can be changed by altering the pitch of the spoken word; how incorrect sentences can be corrected by the listener or the receiver of the information; how the use of grammar can change the information; how the use of grammar can change the meaning of words; and how many different concepts and associations can surround the use of one word, eg cat or girl. Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary levels.

group_works.title: Drying
group_works.creator_credit: Don Kelly and Gerard Holdsworth Productions

results.title: Pressing
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Preserving and Drying of Plant Material”.
One of three films dealing with different aspects of preserving and drying of plant material, showing the techniques and everyday domestic equipment needed to achieve satisfactory results. This film deals with preservation by pressing.
